author: pietjepuk
content: If you have money to spare, you're free to go ahead and burn it if you want to keep the base fee high

author: sky.cactus
content: It would cost a *massive* amount of money to fill blocks for an extended period.  The rate the cost increases is very fast.

author: sky.cactus
content: You might be able to do minutes worth in a row before you are broke, assuming you started very wealthy.  üôÇ

author: peter.davies
content: If you started with a base fee of 1 Gwei and continuously had full blocks the gas fee would get so high that a single full block would consume all ETH in existence in 194 blocks (just under 42 minutes).

author: sky.cactus
content: Hmm, interesting fact!  I didn't know it would get quite *that* high and quite *that* fast.
